availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas B. Cochran (Shelbyville, Lt. Col, 2nd Kentucky Cavalry)

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Spencer County, Kentucky, native. Attended Transylvania University in Lexington, Kentucky. Married to Margaret E. Thorpe on June 22, 1852. Attorney in Shelby County in 1860. Lieutenant Colonel in 2nd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) from September 27, 1861, to November 24th, 1862. Owned two enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District No. 1, p.238
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District No. 1, p. 43.
Thomas B. Cochran and Margaret E. Thorpe, Kentucky, County Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Shelby County, June 22, 1852, (Accessed via Ancestry.com).
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 46.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1867), 915.
“ Thomas B. Cochran: Death of the Chancellor of Louisville Yesterday--Action of the Courts and Bar,” Courier-Journal (Louisville, Kentucky) Jan 22, 1873, p. 4.
